title: fix flip() shape bug in CPU
body_html:
• fix #13292, root cause please see #13682
  • this PR brings in filp() CUDA implementation for CPU kernel
  • with this change:
>>> t = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 5)
>> t.flip(1, 3).shape
torch.Size([1, 3, 4, 5])
  • performance:
====== with this PR ======
>>> a = torch.randn(1000, 1000)
>>> %timeit -r 100 a.flip(0, 1)
1.98 ms ± 579 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 100 runs, 1000 loops each)

====== Perf at previous PR #7873 ======   
100 loops, best of 3: 11 ms per loop
body_text:
fix #13292, root cause please see #13682
this PR brings in filp() CUDA implementation for CPU kernel
with this change:

>>> t = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 5)
>> t.flip(1, 3).shape
torch.Size([1, 3, 4, 5])


performance:

====== with this PR ======
>>> a = torch.randn(1000, 1000)
>>> %timeit -r 100 a.flip(0, 1)
1.98 ms ± 579 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 100 runs, 1000 loops each)

====== Perf at previous PR #7873 ======   
100 loops, best of 3: 11 ms per loop
body:
- fix #13292, root cause please see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/13682
- this PR brings in `filp()` CUDA implementation for CPU kernel
- with this change:
```
>>> t = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 5)
>> t.flip(1, 3).shape
torch.Size([1, 3, 4, 5])
```
- performance:
```
====== with this PR ======
>>> a = torch.randn(1000, 1000)
>>> %timeit -r 100 a.flip(0, 1)
1.98 ms ± 579 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 100 runs, 1000 loops each)

====== Perf at previous PR #7873 ======   
100 loops, best of 3: 11 ms per loop
```
